projects.name: ShapeShiftOS
projects.caption: Founder of Open-Source Android-Based Mobile Operating System
projects.description: Created this project in 2020 and have maintained it since. Authored multiple features including color-palette-based system theming, in-screen fingerprint scanner animations and icons, Google Lens integration in screenshots, custom lockscreen clock with dynamic TrueType font, custom kernel scheduler, upstream contributions to Google Material Components, etc.

projects.name: Bibliotheque (Library Management System)
projects.caption: Open-Source Full-Stack Library Management System built (Next.js, PostgreSQL, TypeScript)
projects.description: Developed a responsive admin dashboard for librarians with real-time CRUD, rich data visualizations, and overdue-book tracking, powered by a PostgreSQL backend (4 tables, 16 RLS policies) and Google OAuth–secured auth. Built a sub-50ms ISBN/title/author search functionality for 1,000+ concurrent queries.

projects.name: Shiv Nadar School Faridabad Food Menu Alexa Skill
projects.caption: Open-Source Food Menu Retriever Alexa Skill for Schools (Node.js, AWS Lambda, Alexa Skills Kit SDK)
projects.description: Built an Alexa Skill that retrieves meal information for a given date and time from the Shiv Nadar School Faridabad Menu. Includes 50+ comprehensive voice interaction dialog templates created over 1 week.

publications.title: Applying Chaos Theory to Traffic Congestion
publications.subtitle: International Journal of Science and Research (IJSR)
publications.description: Research paper applying chaos theory principles through non-linear sinusoidal functions to model complex traffic congestion patterns
publications.journal: International Journal of Science and Research (IJSR)
publications.abstract: Authored a peer-reviewed paper published in the International Journal of Science and Research (Vol. 12, Issue 9), applying chaos theory to model non-linear traffic congestion dynamics. Designed synthetic datasets simulating traffic volume, speed, and congestion using NumPy and Gaussian/Poisson distributions. Developed a sinusoidal-based non-linear model capturing sensitivity to initial conditions and emergent chaotic behavior in traffic systems. Conducted statistical and visual analysis in Python to reveal deterministic yet unpredictable patterns in urban congestion, offering implications for scalable, adaptive city traffic management. Open-sourced all code and models used in the simulation on GitHub.
publications.status: Won first place among 160+ submissions in the paper submission round at the high school Neerja Modi Mathelogics Symposium 2023

publications.title: Impact of Short-Term Rentals on Housing Crisis
publications.subtitle: Ceteris Paribus, SRCC
publications.description: Analysis of Airbnb's impact on urban housing markets and communities
publications.journal: Ceteris Paribus, Shri Ram College of Commerce
publications.abstract: Authored an expository research article analyzing how short-term rental platforms like Airbnb contribute to housing crises in major global cities. Explored urban policy responses, regulatory loopholes, and socio-economic consequences of rental market disruption, drawing from case studies and cross-city comparisons. Highlighted the tension between housing affordability and the growth of platform-driven tourism, emphasizing the need for balanced regulation to protect long-term residential availability.
publications.status: Published by the Economics Society of SRCC, University of Delhi after finishing top 5 in the SRCC Writing Mentorship Program
